util

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Class: Matrix.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Main purpose: realisation of matrix (High Math) logic. Based on 2-dimension integer array.
    Author:
    alex323glo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix(int size)
      Creates square matrix with default size and content (5 x 5 with all elements == 0).
      Matrix(int rows, int cols)
      Creates matrix with inputted size ("rows", "cols") and default content (with all elements == 0).
      Matrix(int rows, int cols, int initialValue)
      Creates matrix with inputted size and content ("rows", "cols" and "initialValue").

      This getter returns number of columns in matrix (length of any subarray in "value" array).

      This getter returns a reference on inner int[][] array ("value" property).

      This method returns the biggest element of current (this) matrix.

      This static method returns the biggest element of inputed matrix (Matrix class instance).

      This static method returns result of matrix-validation check of inputed matrix (2-dimensional int array).

      This method returns result of matrix multiplication of current (this) matrix and integer number.

      This method returns result of matrix multiplication of current (this) matrix and inputed matrix (Matrix class instance).

      This static method returns result of matrix multiplication of matrix (Matrix class instances) and integer number.
      static Matrix multiply(Matrix matrixA, Matrix matrixB)
      This static method returns result of matrix multiplication of two inputed matrices (Matrix class instances).
      int rows()
      This getter returns number of rows in matrix (length of "value" array).
      boolean set(int[][] value)
      This setter resets matrix content and structure (sets new inner int[][] array and resets "rows" and "cols" properties).

      This method returns result of sorting of current (this) matrix's columns.

      This static method returns result of sorting of inputed matrix's columns.

      This static method returns result of sorting of inputed matrix's rows.
      Matrix transpose()
      This method returns result of matrix transpose of current (this) matrix.
      static Matrix transpose(Matrix matrix)
      This static method returns result of matrix transpose of inputed matrix (Matrix class instances).

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int size)
        Creates square matrix with default size and content (5 x 5 with all elements == 0).
        Parameters:
        size - int value, which stands for numbers of rows an columns of square matrix we want to create.
        See Also:
        Matrix(int, int), Matrix(int, int, int)

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int rows,
              int cols)
        Creates matrix with inputted size ("rows", "cols") and default content (with all elements == 0).
        Parameters:
        rows - in value, which stands for number of rows in matrix we want to create.
        cols - in value, which stands for number of columns in matrix we want to create.
        See Also:
        Matrix(int), Matrix(int, int, int)

      • Matrix

        public Matrix(int rows,
              int cols,
              int initialValue)
        Creates matrix with inputted size and content ("rows", "cols" and "initialValue").
        Parameters:
        rows - in value, which stands for number of rows in matrix we want to create.
        cols - in value, which stands for number of columns in matrix we want to create.
        initialValue - int value, which will all matrix's elements be initialized with.
        See Also:
        Matrix(int), Matrix(int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Matrix add(Matrix matrix)
        This method returns result of matrix summing of current (this) matrix and inputed matrix (Matrix class instances).
        All logic description could be found in documentation of static "add(Matrix, Matrix)" method.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix class instance, that has suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed argument or current matrix are wrong.
        See Also:
        add(Matrix, Matrix)

      • add

        public static Matrix add(Matrix matrixA,
                         Matrix matrixB)
        This static method returns result of matrix summing of two inputed matrices (Matrix class instances).
        Attention! This method is a simple realisation of Matrix-toMatrix summing algorithm. Search for more information about this algorithm in any High Math educational resources to understand full logic of this method.
        Parameters:
        matrixA - Matrix class instances, that have suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        matrixB - Matrix class instances, that have suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed arguments are wrong.

      • cols

        public int cols()
        This getter returns number of columns in matrix (length of any subarray in "value" array).
        Returns:
        int value - number of columns in matrix.

      • fill

        public Matrix fill(int digit)
        This method returns reference on formatted (refilled) current (this) matrix.
        All logic description could be found in documentation of static "fill(Matrix, int)" method.
        Attention! This method doesn't create new instance of Matrix class. It changes inputed value by its reference. So, be careful when use it!
        Parameters:
        digit - integer value, which first argument (Matrix class instance) will be filled with.
        Returns:
        reference on changed current matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed arguement or currenr matrix are wrong.
        See Also:
        fill(Matrix, int)

      • fill

        public static Matrix fill(Matrix matrix,
                          int digit)
        This static method returns reference on formatted matrix argument (Matrix class instance).
        Main logic is to fill matrix with "digit" value.
        Attention! This method doesn't create new instance of Matrix class. It changes inputed value by its reference. So, be careful when use it!
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix class instance, that has suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        digit - integer value, which first argument (Matrix class instance) will be filled with.
        Returns:
        reference on changed arguement matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed arguments are wrong.

        This getter returns a reference on inner int[][] array ("value" property).
        Returns:
        inner 2-dimension array "value", which interprets new inner structure of current matrix (this).

        public java.lang.Integer getMaximum()

        result int value (Integer class instance) if success and null if current matrix is wrong.

      • getMaximum

        public static java.lang.Integer getMaximum(Matrix matrix)
        This static method returns the biggest element of inputed matrix (Matrix class instance). Main logic is to search for the biggest element in matrix using nested "for()" statements.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix class instance, that has suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result int value (Integer class instance) if success and null if inputed arguments are wrong.

      • isMatrix

        public static boolean isMatrix(int[][] matrix)
        This static method returns result of matrix-validation check of inputed matrix (2-dimensional int array).
        Main logic is to check if matrix (int[][] array): - is null; - is empty ("matrix" array's length is less than 1); - has any row (int[] array), which is null or empty (its length is less than 1); - has any row (int[] array), which length is not equal to length of the first row ("matrix[0]" array).
        Parameters:
        matrix - 2-dimensional integer array (int[][]).
        Returns:
        true, if inputed argument (array) fits all requirements (were mentioned above), and false, if it doesn't.

      • isSquareMatrix

        public static boolean isSquareMatrix(int[][] matrix)
        This static method returns result of square-matrix-validation check of inputed matrix (2-dimensional int array).
        Main logic is to check if matrix (int[][] array): - is matrix (used isMatrix() method); - its rows number ("matrix" array length) is equal to its columns number - length of any row (subarray of "matrix" array).
        Parameters:
        matrix - 2-dimensional integer array (int[][]).
        Returns:
        true, if inputed argument (array) fits all requirements (were mentioned above), and false, if it doesn't.
        See Also:
        isMatrix(int[][])

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply(int number)
        This method returns result of matrix multiplication of current (this) matrix and integer number.
        All logic description could be found in documentation of static "multiply(Matrix, int)" method.
        Attention! This method is a simple realisation of Matrix-to-Number multiplication algorithm. Search for more information about this algorithm in any High Math educational resources to understand full logic of this method.
        Parameters:
        number - integer value, which first argument (Matrix class instance) will be multiplied by.
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success an null if inputed argument or current matrix are wrong.
        See Also:
        multiply(Matrix, int)

      • multiply

        public static Matrix multiply(Matrix matrixA,
                              Matrix matrixB)
        This static method returns result of matrix multiplication of two inputed matrices (Matrix class instances).
        Attention! This method is a simple realisation of Matrix-to-Matrix multiplication algorithm. Search for more information about this algorithm in any High Math educational resources to understand full logic of this method.
        Parameters:
        matrixA - Matrix class instances, that have suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        matrixB - Matrix class instances, that have suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success an null if inputed arguments are wrong.

        Returns:

      • set

        public boolean set(int[][] value)
        This setter resets matrix content and structure (sets new inner int[][] array and resets "rows" and "cols" properties).
        Parameters:
        value - - ineger 2-dimension array, which interprets new inner structure of current matrix (this).
        Returns:
        true, if set operation was successful, or false, if it wasn't.

      • sortCols

        public Matrix sortCols()
        This method returns result of sorting of current (this) matrix's columns.
        All logic description could be found in documentation of static "sortCols(Matrix)" method.
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if current matrix is wrong.
        See Also:
        sortCols(Matrix)

      • sortCols

        public static Matrix sortCols(Matrix matrix)
        This static method returns result of sorting of inputed matrix's columns.
        Main logic is to transpose inputed matrix (Matrix class instance) using "transpose()" method and than sort each row of transposed matrix (Matrix class instance) using "sort()" method from "Arrays" library (java.util.Arrays). Sorted column logically will have such view as {minimum, ..., maximum}.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix class instance, that has suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed argument is wrong.
        See Also:
        Arrays.sort(int[]), transpose()

      • sortRows

        public Matrix sortRows()
        This method returns result of sorting of current (this) matrix's rows.
        All logic description could be found in documentation of static "sortRows(Matrix)" method.
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if current matrix is wrong.
        See Also:
        sortRows(Matrix)

      • sortRows

        public static Matrix sortRows(Matrix matrix)
        This static method returns result of sorting of inputed matrix's rows.
        Main logic is to sort each row of inputed matrix (Matrix class instance) using "sort()" method from Arrays library (java.util.Arrays). Sorted row logically will have such view as {minimum, ..., maximum}.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix class instance, that has suitable sizes (validated in isMatrix() method and firs "if" statement).
        Returns:
        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed argument is wrong.
        See Also:
        Arrays.sort(int[])

        result matrix (Matrix class instance) if success and null if inputed current matrix is wrong.
